Key Match Events: The Pelicans defeated the Bulls, 123-111, with Brandon Ingram leading the way with 33 points and C.J. McCollum adding 23.
Lonzo Ball played 13 minutes and 39 seconds, tallying five points and four assists in his return to regular-season action.
Pre-Game Insights: Bulls coach Billy Donovan noted that Lonzo Ball would be limited to 14-16 minutes of playing time as the team continues to monitor his recovery.
Post-Match Reflections: The guard's comeback story was nothing short of impressive, considering the career-threatening injuries he faced.
Others: Lonzo Ball's troubles began with a torn meniscus, which caused him to miss part of the 2021-22 season. He later had an arthroscopic debridement to remove debris from that procedure. In March 2023, Ball underwent a revolutionary third surgery — a cartilage transplant to replace the damaged meniscus.
During the offseason, the Bulls traded Alex Caruso for young guard Josh Giddey from the OKC Thunder.
